alert.note: Alert for Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 3:23PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Sumter County through 400 PM CDT... At 323 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near York, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Livingston, York, Cuba, Boyd, Kinterbish, The University Of West Alabama, Old Mallard Airport, Bellamy, I 20 Welcome Center At Cuba, Ward, Payneville and Lilita. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
